greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} (1 - x^k)^(sigma_2(k)).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: exp(-Sum_{k>=1} sigma_3(k)*x^k/(k*(1 - x^k))). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Oct 29 2018
mathematica: nmax = 50; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1-x^k)^DivisorSigma[2, k], {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2018 *)
program: (PARI) m=50; x='x+O('x^m); Vec(prod(k=1, m, (1-x^k)^sigma(k,2))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2018
(MAGMA) m:=50; R<q>:=PowerSeriesRing(Rationals(), m); Coefficients(R! ( (&*[(1-q^k)^DivisorSigma(2,k): k in [1..m]]) )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2018
xref: Product_{k>=1} (1 - x^k)^sigma_m(k): A288098 (m=0), A288385 (m=1), this sequence (m=2), A288392 (m=3).
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 08 2017
